Why do some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, flag the Verus mining software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Antivirus software may flag the Verus mining software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" because it is mining software, which can be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This warning does not necessarily mean that the software is malicious, but rather that it has the potential to be used for malicious purposes if installed by an unauthorized party.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources: https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/ https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/ v0.5.5c introduces a portability fix for a fault on some CPUs that did not support optimized mining when attempting to mine. This allows mining on CPUs that don't support optimizations, although they will be relatively slow.**MAKE SURE TO UPGRADE TO 0.5.5 OR GREATER ASAP.
